question: Changing coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period.
text:
Changing coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period.
          
        
In order to make changes to your current enrollment outside of the annual Open Enrollment Period, you must experience a
Qualifying Life Event (QLE).
A QLE is a change in life circumstances that may make you eligible for a Special Enrollment Period, during which you may make changes to your enrollment.


Loss of Minimum Essential Coverage like job-based coverage or Medical Assistance.



Change in household size (e.g., birth of a child, marriage, divorce).




Change of residence; and



Change in income that makes you newly eligible/ineligible for financial assistance.


If you are currently enrolled through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace and need to report a QLE, log into your online Virginia's Insurance Marketplace account and click Edit Application. Once your application is updated, click Confirm Event and Shop to report your QLE and enroll in coverage.
